title: Variation Theory-Based Educational Software Design Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of educational technology and experience with software applications
context.additional_context: Learners are office/managerial professionals interested in software design for language education, operating in a digital device-enabled learning environment. Project-based assessments validate practical application skills.

learning_goals: Learners can apply the four design principles of variation theory (guiding learning, clarifying learning objects, exploring variation, maintaining invariance) to educational software.
Learners can analyze target language learning elements and concretely plan software interface design accordingly.
Learners can develop interactive modules in an LMS environment that accommodate large-scale learner groups.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
